channel.title: Okay... Second attempt!
channel.description:
Last time I Did this, I Fucked up and had to reinstall Windows, Because it was wiped.
Im attempting to Partion Linux & Windows
Ive followed a Vid Guide thurruly and I Just cant seem to work out the Partioning Step,
Can somone explain it in full detail!?

item.title: Okay... Second attempt!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Just Stick all your data you want to keep onto removable media.

Then install via live cd and select the automatic/guided option.

I installed windows and all i got was a lousey blue screen

Read full topic

item.title: Okay... Second attempt!
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:4, topic:102643”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=147063.msg1398950#msg1398950 date=1180524420]
defragment, defragment, defragment, NTFS allows files to be fragmented, so fix that before you try anything.

Afterwards, boot your favorite linux livecd, follow the instructions, when it asks you where you want to install it, click partition manually, then do it.
[/quote]
may i ask you why i should do this, as i didn’t, afaik[/quote]

http://www.videomaker.com/blog/2007/01/208-why-defrag

Read full topic

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:102643”]defragment, defragment, defragment, NTFS allows files to be fragmented, so fix that before you try anything.

Afterwards, boot your favorite linux livecd, follow the instructions, when it asks you where you want to install it, click partition manually, then do it.[/quote]

item.title: Okay... Second attempt!
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

Thank you mopar,

Ill see how i go.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 30, 2007, 04:40:05 PM[/size][hr]Ive Partitioned it all correctly, Allocating 10GB For Root i have also allocated 2GB for linux-swap.

But it says “Unable to Move dirve: NTFS (and my hd product name)”

??

Read full topic

item.title: Okay... Second attempt!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

defragment, defragment, defragment, NTFS allows files to be fragmented, so fix that before you try anything.

Afterwards, boot your favorite linux livecd, follow the instructions, when it asks you where you want to install it, click partition manually, then do it.

Read full topic
